title: libert19
author: libert19
content: Tried ledger with metamask, didn't have ledger support, looked around a bit and found Encrypt, built by myetherwallet team, open source. Website and download: https://www.enkrypt.com/Supports evm chains and Bitcoin. Install kiwi browser to use extension.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: For those who don't need Ledger for altcoins Blockstream Green (open source) and Mycelium (closed source) are also popular options and I pretty much recommend both of them.I've tried out Green, but maybe I'm not as open to new as I'd like to admit, hence I kept Mycelium which I've used for longer.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: i don't know how u guys connect the wallet to ur android device?because ledger nano-s doesn't have the bluetooth interface.i tried doing it with the otg cable but it was not recognized by my phone.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: IIrik11 on April 20, 2023, 05:14:40 AMi tried doing it with the otg cable but it was not recognized by my phone.Does this mean you tried to connect it to the Ledger Live app and failed? The process is quite straightforward as long as you use a wallet that supports a hardware wallet connection and a phone with Android 8+ (that's what is stated on the Ledger website, never tried it to verify myself for a lower Android version). For example, here's the official guide to connect your HW to the Ledger Live app[1]. The steps should be similar if you use other wallets app. CMIIW.[1] https://support.ledger.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021488913-Connect-Ledger-to-your-phone

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: IIrik11 on April 20, 2023, 02:48:32 PMbtw, i had ledger live and electrum installed on my phone and they both support hw wallets.Unless I'm missing some new changes, Electrum for Android doesn't support HW.Just look up my post for the wallets I've used with my Ledger on Android.About the cable I don't know what is wrong, but it looks to me it's not a working otg/data cable.I used an adapter from normal USB (A) to USBC and I use the stock Ledger cable with the adapter and it works. With the previous phone I used the same Ledger S with the same cable, just the adapter was USB (A) to microUSB.
